meanings.definition: Made efficient by stripping off nonessentials.
meanings.sent1: The car had a streamlined design, making it faster than the others.
meanings.sent2: The new software had a more streamlined interface, making it easier to use.
meanings.sent3: The streamlined process saved us a lot of time and effort.
meanings.sent4: Her streamlined approach to problem-solving impressed everyone.
meanings.sent5: The streamlined workflow improved productivity significantly.

meanings.sent1: The streamlined airplane cut through the air effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The swimmer wore a streamlined swimsuit to glide through the water faster.
meanings.sent3: The streamlined helmet made him look like a superhero.
meanings.sent4: Her streamlined outfit made her look sleek and aerodynamic.
meanings.sent5: The streamlined shape of the boat helped it move swiftly across the water.

meanings.definition: To make more efficient by removing unnecessary elements.
meanings.sent1: She streamlined the process by eliminating redundant steps.
meanings.sent2: The company streamlined its operations to cut costs.
meanings.sent3: He streamlined his wardrobe by donating clothes he no longer wore.
meanings.sent4: The chef streamlined the recipe to make it easier for home cooks.
meanings.sent5: The manager streamlined the meeting agenda for better time management.
